column4: Ubuntu hangs on "booting kernel" in a fresh install in an Acer laptop, I read in a forum I need to enter "linux noapci", but where? and how do I avoid that in each boot?
eh, that is done on the first boot at the install and it works
but in the Grub menu what do I do?
the machine boots, the Grub menu shows up, and if I choose Linux-server boots until the kernel is loaded and there it hangs
there is an 'e' key to press to edit the boot
if I press that in the default option I see boot/kernel/initrd/savedefault/boot
do I need to add "linux noapci" there?
use that - and only edit the "kenel" lines
use that - and only edit the "kernel" line
oh, so that line ends in ro quiet splash, do I just add noapci at the end?
append it to the end of the line, yes
when the machine is booted do this "sudo nano /boot/grub/menu.lst" that is a L and add it to the end of the kernel lines

thank you, the advice in that forum is not helping unfortunately, BTW I recalled it wrongly before, it hangs after the trace "booting the kernel", so maybe the kernel is not successfully loaded indeed
it's a pity, it even configured the wifi in the installation
